pr_title: Remove auth-id and credentials type regex pattern from API

timeline.message:
Remove auth-id and credentials type regex pattern from API

Also removed obsolete parameter type and improved documentation of
credentials and secrets objects.

Signed-off-by: Kai Hudalla <kai.hudalla@bosch.io>

timeline.author: calohmn

timeline.bodyText: Now that is validator isn't used as default anymore and is only used for a PasswordCredential, I think the CredentialsConstants.PATTERN_AUTH_ID_VALUE constant should be moved to the PasswordCredential class as well, or the javadoc there should be adapted to not give the impression that this pattern is used for all auth-id values in all kinds of credentials.
timeline.author: calohmn

replies.bodyText: I agree. I will move the constant to the PasswordCredential class.
replies.author: sophokles73

timeline.bodyText: With this change the javadoc mentioning the IllegalArgumentException in the PskCredential and GenericCredential constructors isn't correct anymore.
timeline.author: calohmn

timeline.bodyText:
PATTERN_AUTH_ID_VALUE not generally used anymore, so I would suggest:
Instead of "to match the ...", using something like "to pass the corresponding authIdValidator check".
timeline.author: calohmn

timeline.bodyText: "PSK credential" not used in this test.
timeline.author: calohmn

timeline.bodyText:
The IllegalArgumentException thrown here doesn't seem to come from the auth-id validation ("Missing required creator property 'secrets' (index 1)").
Same for the code below.
